Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery skyphos; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of part of fat, nude male to right (lower body, thighs and right elbow preserved; dark brown lines on abdomen, above navel and hook-shaped on flank, all suggesting fat; dilute brown for pubic hair; left leg raised and elbow resting on it; on left, part of unclear motif, possibly a thong, drapery, or a tail; relief-contour on top of left thigh; preliminary sketch.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0354) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
